article.name: Grant Student Edition Access
article.title: Grant Student Edition Access
article.body:
Student Edition is a ModStore add-on option for current KnowBe4 customers. Student Edition content gives your students the tools they need to help mitigate security risks at their organization.

Important: Additional minimum subscription purchasing requirements may apply.

Creating User Groups for Student Training

For the best results, we recommend creating a user group that only includes students. Make sure to name it something easy to find, such as “Students Only.” For more detailed instructions, see our Create a Group article. If you have a Platinum or higher subscription, you can also automate this process using Smart Groups. For more information on Smart Groups, see the Smart Groups Overview article.

Creating a Security Role for Students

We recommend creating a specific, dedicated security role for managing students. For more information on security roles, see our Security Roles Guide article.

Follow the steps below to create a Security Role:

  1. Log in to your KnowBe4 console and navigate to the Users tab.
  2. Click on the Security Roles subtab.
  3. In the top-right corner of the page, click the +New Security Role button.
  4. Enter a descriptive name for the Security Role, such as “Student Management”
  5. Select the student group you created in the above section from the Groups drop-down menu.
  6. Click on the Training subtab and edit the training permissions of this Security Role.
    • Keep all the Training permissions set to No Access.
  7. Click on the ModStore subtab to edit the ModStore permissions for this Security Role.
    • Keep all the ModStore permissions to No Access.
  8. When you are satisfied with your settings, click the Create Security Role button.

This image displays a configuration screen for defining permissions within the "Create Security Role" workflow.

**Context and Navigation:**
The primary heading is "Create Security Role." A navigation link, "← Back to Security Roles," is located in the top right corner. Below the heading is a seven-step tabbed navigation structure: "Role Description," "General," "Phishing," "SecurityCoach," "Training," "ModStore," and "Reporting." The **ModStore** tab is currently active.

**Content and Permissions Configuration:**
The main content area lists specific features requiring access level definition. Each feature label is accompanied by a help icon (circular question mark). Access levels are controlled by horizontal, three-state segmented controls offering the following permissions:

1.  **ModStore:** Access segmented control (Default: No Access)
2.  **Library:** Access segmented control (Default: No Access)
3.  **Uploaded Content:** Access segmented control (Default: No Access)
4.  **Brandable Content and Content Manager:** Access segmented control (Default: No Access)

For all listed features, the currently selected access state is **No Access** (highlighted in dark gray). The alternative options are "Read" and "Read/Write."

**Action Button:**
At the bottom of the form is a blue, primary call-to-action button labeled **Create Security Role**.
